intro: Pegia bijuga, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters, featuring heart-shaped leaves and vibrant orange to red flowers. Its botanical name reflects its native range and unique morphology. Pegia bijuga thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
